title: Information disclosure by sending a GIF

activities.message: The vulnerability category was supposed to be "Information Disclosure CWE-200", I chose it wrong.

Hey @qualwin3001,

Could you provide details on how this report is different from your previous report here: #1798047 ?

Thank you!

@h1_analyst_ivan

I wrote the same as my previous report in a more understandable way, the security impact does not affect the system, it affects the users.

this vulnerability violates the privacy of your users

I would like it to be examined in more detail
Update?

Hey @qualwin3001,

Thank you for your report!

After review, there doesnâ€™t seem to be any significant security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing.

The behavior you described is how modern browsers work. Sending an image pointing to your server,  directly to the victim  and in any application, will leak their IP address. 

As a result, we will be closing this report as informative. If you are able to leverage this into a practical exploitation scenario, we will be happy to reevaluate this report.

Moreover, please do not reopen another report about this issue or we'll be forced to close it as `Spam`

This will not have any impact on your Signal or Reputation score. We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future.

Kind regards,
@h1_analyst_robert

Did I just mention that you don't disclose IP addresses? The iPhone gives device-specific critical information? e.g ; The location can be found thanks to Device-ID.

If you need more samples ; Suppose I am contacting a famous person on LinkedIn and learning that person's device information is a big reveal.
In addition, it is important to leak the IP address of a government institution that is open to the outside. because there are administrative pages that we cannot enter and that they can enter, and imagine that these IP addresses belong to those pages?

If I need to give more examples; The iPhone gives information about the device that should not be given. I want it to be checked again, there is a vulnerability here. but I still can't explain.

If the user on the other end is entering via an IPhone device, will he/she give me this critical information as soon as he/she sees my message?
How can you say there is no security impact here?

I'm talking about Device-ID, the location can be found.

The IP address part is; Imagine if a government agency leaked an IP address with no outside access? access to the private websites of the government institution with this IP address, etc. is in question.

In short, a better look will see critical information only: see the X-LI-Track header.

If you think this still has no security impact, we should test it. See my message on an iPhone as an example and I'll show you again what I can see.

{F2076086}

only IPhone does not give information about the device.

Huawei, Samsung and more..

but it gives critical information in the iPhone section.

In addition ; you can run a malicious site you specify in the background. The victim will not see it.

but the focus will be on the number of iPhone users in the world, and 9 out of 10 people I will correspond with have an iPhone. So what will this information be? still no security effect?

this is a security hazard for large companies.
any Update?

Hey @qualwin3001,

The team is still looking into this. I have reached out for an update.

Thank you for your patience.

@h1_analyst_ivan

## Note
In a job posting on LinkedIn, LinkedIn added the following message to the responsibilities section: "You will be responsible for continuous monitoring of third parties to ensure all security gaps are mitigated and reported to impacted owners"

According to this message, it is said that LinkedIn employees are responsible for any security vulnerability that may occur on users.

The vulnerability we found affects users and companies to a large extent.
update?
@qualwin3001 Thank you for your report. We were able to validate the report and are working towards a fix.
Hi! Will I get a reward for this report? I want to ask this because "this vulnerability does not have a category" I think it was discovered for the first time.

Hey @qualwin3001,

The team is still looking into this. I have reached out for an update.

Thank you for your patience.

@h1_analyst_ivan

Regarding the degree of importance; I don't know how medium 4.3 happened, the vulnerability is discovered for the first time. never found it this way before.
devices and users are compromised , low or none, very impressive.
Hello! , any update?

Hey @qualwin3001,

The team is still working towards a fix and will provide you with the final decision related to severity.

From our point of vie integrity and availability is `none`. The IP and OS version do not effect these components of the CVSS scale.

Confidentiality is marked as `low` due to `high` being reserved for `total loss of confidentiality i.e. PII`.

Thank you!

@h1_analyst_ivan
While this vulnerability does not directly damage the app itself, it exposes users' important information. This reduces trust in LinkedIn and damages the company's reputation.
Thank you! But I still advocate severity, I need you to give me an update on this. what is your opinion?
We believe this issue has been resolved. Please take a moment to reassess and let us know if you disagree. Thank you!

Yes! This issue has been resolved. What about the severity of the vulnerability? Doesn't this seem odd? It affected the area that Linkedin covers the most, which is the message section.

A lot of organisations, celebrities and important people could have been affected, right?

I'd like an explanation.

Kind regards.
Update?

Hi @qualw1n 
Thank you for reaching out.

Based on internal review on the severity the team has confirmed that:

> We try to consider the impact and the security risk associated with the specific functionality. This does not have security impact beyond getting the ip-address, and user agent of the user and hence the severity reflects the same.

Hopefully that clears things up. Let me know if you have any additional questions!
So can we disclose him?
